result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M Dettmering was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jason M Dettmering

parties.name: Dodge County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer - IMPOSED AND STAYED.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay fine, costs and DNA surcharge within the term of probation. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Upon successful completion of probation, the record shall be expunged pursuant to Sec. 973.015.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
15CM152 & 15CM250: Defendant Jason M Dettmering in court with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will plead today; Courr reviews recomm.; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; Court reviews charge/penalties; Def. pleads NC to DC/DAA in 15CM152 and NC to BJ in 15CM250; parties stip. to most facts; Court finds pleas made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of DC/DAA in 15CM152 and BJ in 15CM250 w/uncharged BJ referral D&RI; victim rights complied with; State heard; Atty. Jansen heard; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence; Def. to report to P&P by 4pm on Tuesday

15CM152 - Impose and Stay 90 days DCJ w/H&Tr. - 1 year PO
15CM250 - W/H - 1 year PO concurrent
- $100 F+C = $479 in 15CM152
- $243 CC in 15CM250
- $200 DNA surcharge each count
- no violent or abusive contact w/anyone
- no drugs, etc.
- absolute sobriety, no bars
- AODA & FT
- Expungement

ADDRESS INFO for Jason M Dettmering
Current: W3695 Cty Rd. S, Iron Ridge, WI 53035 United States  (Effective: 07-09-2015)
Prior: 207 Wayland Street, Beaver Dam, WI 53916

Attorney Bradley J Jansen appeared.  Def. not in Court.  Attorney Gilbert Thompson appears for the State. Atty Jansen heard on reason why Def. is not present; he did not have date down on his calendar, Atty Jansen gave Ct. current address, Def. has another CM in Br. 4 set for 7/23, wishes to resolve both matters. Atty Thompson heard, gave Def. until 7/22 to work out agreement, otherwise will request approval from Ct. to add additional charge. Ct. will reset for another in-person status. Ct. goes off record to schedule.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Review hearing on May 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant, Jason M Dettmering in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held. Court sets Review Hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, S.A.H., dob 2/18/90 or her residence.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

(1:06) Defendant Jason M Dettmering in custody via video with Intern Austin Heiman (Shelton) (declined SPD).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. State heard on bond and bond conditions; RD 5/11/15 at 3:30pm & JT 6/9/15 at 8:30am in Br. 3; Court sets $500.00 PA Bond with conditions:    Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, SAH, dob 2/18/90 or her residence.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.
